text: The 2008–09 OK Liga was the 40th season of the top-tier league of rink hockey in Spain. Barcelona Sorli Discau finished the league as champion. ==Competition format== Sixteen teams joined the league. The eight first teams at the end of the regular season qualified for the playoffs while the three last teams were relegated to Primera División. ==Regular season== ==Playoffs== Quarterfinals were played with a best-of-three format, while semifinals and final were played with a best-of-five series. Seeded teams played games 1 and 3 of the quarterfinals and 1, 2 and 5 of semifinals and finals at home. ==Final standings== {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" |- ! width=30| !! Team !! Qualification or relegation |- bgcolor=#BBF3BB | 1 || align=left|Barcelona Sorli Discau || CERH European League |- bgcolor=#BBF3FF | 2 || align=left|Coinasa Liceo || CERS Cup |- bgcolor=#BBF3BB | 3 || align=left|Roncato Vic || rowspan=3|CERH European League |- bgcolor=#BBF3BB | 4 || align=left|Alnimar Reus Deportiu |- bgcolor=#BBF3BB | 5 || align=left|Noia Freixenet |- bgcolor=#BBF3FF | 6 || align=left|Proinosa Igualada || CERS Cup |- bgcolor=#BBF3BB | 7 || align=left|Grup Lloret || CERH European League |- | 8 || align=left|Grup Castillo Lleida || |- bgcolor=#BBF3FF | 9 || align=left|Enrile PAS Alcoy || rowspan=3|CERS Cup |- bgcolor=#BBF3FF | 10 || align=left|Viva Hàbitat Blanes |- bgcolor=#BBF3FF | 11 || align=left|Vilanova L'Ull Blau |- | 12 || align=left|Astra Pool Maçanet || rowspan=2| |- | 13 || align=left|Cemex Tenerife |- bgcolor=#FEDCBA | 14 || align=left|Grup Clima Mataró || Relegation and CERH European League |- bgcolor=#FFBBBB | 15 || align=left|Güell Voltregà || rowspan=2|Relegation to Primera División |- bgcolor=#FFBBBB | 16 || align=left|Sitges Arian |} ==Copa del Rey== The 2009 Copa del Rey was the 66th edition of the Spanish men's roller hockey cup. It was played in A Coruña between the eight first qualified teams after the first half of the season. Roncato Vic won its 2nd cup. ==References== ==External links== *Real Federación Española de Patinaje Category:OK Liga seasons Category:2008 in roller hockey Category:2009 in roller hockey Category:2008 in Spanish sport Category:2009 in Spanish sport
title: 2008–09 OK Liga
